Movement is slow and clunky. Poor control responsivity. Worse, the dodge control has extremely poor accuracy and doesn‚Äôt give you invulnerability frames which should be a given in this type of game.

If you‚Äôre looking for a good story, great mechanics, controls are smooth, graphics amazingly have held up since I originally purchased the game, different playable characters that aren‚Äôt terribly difficult to unlock or rank up, and challenges that help you unlock better equipment then this is the game for you. Biggest problem is there‚Äôs no sequel or any game like it that I can find. Absolute bravo

title.label: It was ahead of it‚Äôs time.

content.label: Mobile games are littered with garbage cash-grabs, only a handful of rare hidden gems, and this is one of top hidden gem. It was ahead of it‚Äôs time when it first came out, amazing graphics, amazing gameplay, intuitive UI, and the difficulties are challenging. But that‚Äôs the beauty of it, no pay or watch ads to cheat death, none of those BS.

title.label: Needs greater variety of enemies, but amazing game otherwise

content.label: I would like a much greater variety of enemies, and the zombie fodder enemies are kind of overused. The  boss enemies and minibosses are challenging and interesting to fight, but I want more types of enemies. This is really my only complaint about this game, as the graphics/music are great and the combat system (reminiscent of Devil May Cry and God of War) is polished, satisfying, and fairly deep, and  skill in combat is more important than equipment/stats). Controls are top-notch and there are tons of cool unlockables (especially new mecha suits) that require no in-app purchases. So it‚Äôs really just more enemy variety I want.
